title: Add shopping and location learning units

requirements.text: Add new conversation scenarios focused on asking about malls, shops, and places. Include dialogues for finding stores, asking for directions to shopping areas, inquiring about store locations, and asking what shops are nearby.

quotes: add more units about asking for malls, shops and places

acceptanceCriteria: At least 3-5 new conversation scenarios added to the backend data for each of the 6 supported languages
Scenarios cover common shopping-related interactions: finding malls, locating specific shops, asking for directions to stores, and inquiring about nearby shopping areas
Each scenario follows the existing ConversationScenario structure with prompt, expectedAnswer, and feedback in both English and target language
Scenarios are appropriately tagged and integrated into the existing conversation data structure

requirements.text: Add new culture entries about shopping customs, marketplace traditions, and commercial areas in African cultures corresponding to the 6 supported languages (Arabic, Swahili, Hausa, Amharic, Yoruba, Zulu).

quotes: add more units about asking for malls, shops and places

acceptanceCriteria: At least 2-3 new culture entries per language covering shopping etiquette, traditional markets, modern malls, or commercial district customs
Each entry follows the existing CultureEntry structure with title, content, funFact, and imageUrl in both English and target language
Content provides cultural context relevant to shopping and commercial interactions in regions where each language is spoken
Entries are integrated into the backend data and accessible through the existing culture endpoints

requirements.text: Ensure the new shopping-related conversation scenarios and culture entries appear as unlockable nodes in the learning path, interleaved according to the existing buildLearningPath logic.

quotes: add more units about asking for malls, shops and places

acceptanceCriteria: New shopping-related units appear in the LearningPage as nodes in the learning path
Units are properly grouped and labeled (e.g., 'Unit 3: Shopping & Places', 'Unit 4: Markets & Stores')
Lock/unlock states work correctly based on completion of previous nodes
XP rewards are properly awarded upon completion of shopping-related lessons
The learningPathLimit of 20 nodes is respected and new content is included within this display constraint

constraints: Maintain the single-actor architecture in backend/main.mo
Follow the existing ConversationScenario and CultureEntry type structures
Do not modify immutable frontend paths (useInternetIdentity.ts, useActor.ts, main.tsx, components/ui)
New content must support all 6 existing languages: Arabic, Swahili, Hausa, Amharic, Yoruba, Zulu
Respect the 20-node display limit defined in learningPathLimit.ts
nonGoals: Creating new minigames for shopping scenarios
Modifying the existing minigame configurations or difficulty scaling
Adding new languages beyond the existing 6
Changing the learning path UI layout or node visualization
Implementing real shopping or e-commerce features
